intro: Senecio cobanensis, commonly known as the Cobán senecio, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its foliage is usually gray-green with a woolly texture, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
